ygData.messageBody:
At 01:30 PM 10/11/00 -0500, you wrote:

>Despite every flame you've made at anyone who disagrees with you - I find no
>compelling argument you've made that bards are equally balanced as the more
>powerful classes in the game (not that Bards are the only underpowered
>class...)
>
>Slyde

that kind of depends on what your definition of balanced is. if your definition
of balanced is ''can do the exact same things as'' or ''can get the exact same
experience as in the same amount of time solo'' then of course you will see
bards as underpowered. but a bard (played well) is much more of an asset
in any dungeon than a druid overall. a bard can solo much better than a warrior
or paladin. a bard is not as good as an enchanter in very hi level situations, i.e.
53+. a bard can't solo quite as well as a druid. seems like we have lots of options
and while we may not be the best at any one thing we are pretty darn good at
a lot of them, at least as far as i can tell up to 53. maybe at 56 or 57 we turn
more one dimensional but i haven't seen it yet.
